humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the tumor classification is oT2N3aL1V0RX. According to the new rule 13, N3 indicates metastases in 4 or more axillary lymph nodes, or in in-transit, satellite, or micrometastases (N3mi) in 4 or more lymph nodes, or in ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes in the absence of axillary lymph node metastases. The 'N3a' in the tumor classification suggests that there are metastases in 4 or more axillary lymph nodes, which corresponds to N3. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The 'N' in the tumor classification (TNM staging system) provided in the pathology report refers to the lymph node involvement. In this report, the 'N3a' indicates that there are positive cancer cells in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N3.
